title: Pentagonal gyrocupolarotunda
summary: In geometry, the pentagonal gyrocupolarotunda is one of the Johnson solids  (J33). Like the pentagonal orthocupolarotunda (J32), it can be constructed by joining a pentagonal cupola (J5) and a pentagonal rotunda (J6) along their decagonal bases. The difference is that in this solid, the two halves are rotated 36 degrees with respect to one another.
